fields.label: ENDORSEMENT
fields.options:
The following Definitions and Proviso’s in the Standard Domestic Cover wording shall be amended to read as follows:


1. Definition 1 - Insurable Transaction


An “Insurable Transaction” means any goods delivered or services rendered by the Insured to a buyer, after the inception date of the policy, on credit terms not exceeding 180 days and excluding any goods delivered on consignment, cash sales or cash payments by a negotiable instrument.


1. Proviso 11 - Declarations Of Transactions


A. The Insured shall declare to BECI, in respect of each Insured Buyer individually, on the formsprovided by BECI for this purpose, the gross invoice value of all Insurable Transactions in respect of each Insured Buyer as follows:


i. concluded for each month from the inception date of the policy or the effective date of the annual policy review with each Insured customer;


ii. The gross invoice value shall include any insurance, freight or other charges payable by the Insured on behalf of the Insured Buyer but shall exclude VAT.


A. The declarations shall be sent by the Insured in order to reach BECI within 14 days after the end of each month from the Inception Date of the policy or from the effective date of the annual policy renewal.


B. The Insured shall also declare to BECI, in respect of each Insured Buyer individually, on the forms provided by BECI for this purpose, the Insured Debt that is 30 days or more overdue for payment by the Insured Buyer. This declaration must reach BECI within 14 days after the end of each calendar month.


2. Proviso 13 - Premiums / Credit Limit Fees


The minimum premium shown in Section 6(a) of the schedule shall be paid by the insured to BECI before the issue of the policy and shall be applied in reduction of premiums payable. Once the minimum premium has been liquidated, any additional premium


A. payable shall be settled by the Insured upon receipt of BECI’s statement


B. The minimum monthly premium shall be the product of monthly gross turnover (gross invoice value) and the relevant premium rate shown in Section 6(b) of the schedule.


C. The premium shall be paid by the Insured to BECI on presentation of the invoice raised on the basis of (A) above.


D. In addition, the Insured shall pay a monthly fee as specified in Section 6(c) of the schedule for each Credit Limit in force at the end of each month.


SIGNED for and on behalf of BECI
